useCase.name: End Mission
useCase.description: Recall UAV(s) back to their home-bases.

preconditions.precondition: UAVs are active and registered with DroneResponse.

successEndConditions.condition: All UAVs safely returned to launch and deactivated.

failureEndConditions.condition: One or more UAVs fail to return to a safe landing base.

useCase.trigger: An emergency responder decides to abort the mission or the mission is complete and an end mission command is initiated.

mainSequence.step: The mission is completed and UAVs are recalled home.
The system checks that all recalled UAVs have unique home coordinates.
UAVs each plan their own routes back to their unique home coordinates.
Each UAV leases airspace for the next leg of its planned route and awaits clearance.
Upon receiving clearance, the UAV flies to the target waypoint.
Steps S4-S5 are repeated until the UAV returns to its launch coordinates and lands safely.

asteps.step: The mission commander decides to end the mission before the intended tasks are completed and recalls all UAVs back to their base.
While a UAV is returning to base, the mission commander assigns it a new task.
The END_MISSION command is cancelled for this UAV.
The UAV commences its new mission.

esteps.description: Multiple UAVs have been assigned the same home coordinates.
esteps.step: For any group of UAVs with home coordinates that violate minimum separation distance, the system removes the home coordinates for all except one of them.
UAVs without assigned home coordinates are assigned new in-air temporary coordinates.
UAVs with in-air home coordinates follow steps S3-S5 until reaching the in-air coordinates and then hover in place.
The Remote Pilot in Command (RPIC) manually controls the landing of any UAV with in-air home coordinates.
